parametrized_description: A honey farmer sells his honey in glass and plastic jars. A glass jar can hold GlassJarCapacity of honey while a plastic jar can hold PlasticJarCapacity of honey. Since glass jars are more expensive, at least MinPlasticToGlassRatio as many plastic jars must be filled as glass jars. However, at least MinNumberGlassJars glass jars should be filled. If the farmer has TotalHoney of honey, how many jars of each should be filled to maximize the total number of bottles filled?

GlassJarCapacity.description: The capacity of a glass jar in milliliters

PlasticJarCapacity.description: The capacity of a plastic jar in milliliters

MinPlasticToGlassRatio.description: The minimum ratio of plastic jars to glass jars that must be filled

MinNumberGlassJars.description: The minimum number of glass jars that must be filled

TotalHoney.description: Total amount of honey available in milliliters

GlassJarsFilled.description: The number of glass jars that are filled

PlasticJarsFilled.description: The number of plastic jars filled

constraints.description: At least MinNumberGlassJars glass jars must be filled.
The number of plastic jars filled must be at least MinPlasticToGlassRatio times the number of glass jars filled.
The total amount of honey used by the filled jars cannot exceed TotalHoney.

objective.description: The total number of jars filled is the sum of glass jars and plastic jars. The objective is to maximize the total number of jars filled.
